messages.message:
@Xindi Xu and I are interested in exploring frontend observability for the hackathon next week - the dream is to make everyone a debugging wizard with easy-to-use tools! :magic:

one approach is to use Sentry (https://sentry.io/welcome/)
• pros: nice UI for aggregating errors, showing error history, etc
• cons: more expensive if we use SaaS, more work if we use the free self-hosted option (https://develop.sentry.dev/self-hosted)
another approach is to use Faro (https://grafana.com/oss/faro/) to propagate frontend errors/logs to Grafana
• pros: would work for on-prem and SaaS
• cons: UI is not as nice for debugging :sweat_smile:
would anyone else be interested in joining? :blob_excited: :team-teamwork-parrot:
Would LogRocket work for on-prem? I've never used it before
apparently logrocket has a self-hosted option (https://logrocket.com/features/saas-self-hosted), so that’s also an option!

Hey @Serena this would be a good addition to frontend observability. Also smth that never got above priority. If you are looking for help @abhitaker might have good context here.

My personal take on choice of backends- go with Faro as it will be much easier to integrate and ship. Usability in form of alerts etc will be much better. Sentry also has a license to procure? Btw Grafana labs move their offerings fast to catch up with competitors quickly in general
For rollout we should do internal envs like saas aihub, and then put on prem next on plan if we decide to ship this
Lmk if you need any inputs

yep i chatted with @abhitaker briefly in person, and i’ll schedule a more in-depth chat with him!

i think the grafana UI is slightly hard to use (see some recent wishlist items (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KJCAzgBNDtBfb2Ow2pXOvLTyAx1wnImXxPmdpKy-6NM/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.z8i4ylgbw8pf) from Lydia)

also, recently we’ve been seeing some flakiness (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KJCAzgBNDtBfb2Ow2pXOvLTyAx1wnImXxPmdpKy-6NM/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.kegnr61wyy8o) on grafana for logs/traces, so i’m not sure if the same issues would impact frontend observability via faro as well
